bibl.title: Oikistes. Studies in Constitutions, Colonies, and Military Power in the Ancient World. Offered in Honor of A.J. Graham
bibl.note: "Although we can never know for certain what happened at Actium on September 2nd, Octavian's dedication of rams reflects his mind soon after the battle, long before he had settled on the version he wished posterity to remember."
bibl.seg: MURRAY William M., Reconsidering the Battle of Actium - Again.

Vanessa B. GORMAN and Eric W. ROBINSON (Edd.), Oikistes. Studies in Constitutions, Colonies, and Military Power in the Ancient World. Offered in Honor of A.J. Graham = Mnemosyne. Supplementum 234 (Leiden, 2002) pp. 339-360, 4 figg., 1 tabl.

"Although we can never know for certain what happened at Actium on September 2nd, Octavian's dedication of rams reflects his mind soon after the battle, long before he had settled on the version he wished posterity to remember."
